Detailed Description

Abstract base class for creating AccountAuthenticators.

In order to be an authenticator one must extend this class, provider implementations for the abstract methods and write a delegate that returns the result of getIBinder() in the delegate's gaia::core::Delegate#onBind(gaia::core::Demand*) when invoked with an demand with action AccountManager#ACTION_AUTHENTICATOR_DEMAND. This delegate must specify the following demand filter and metadata tags in its Gaia.xml file 

   <demand-filter>
     <action gaia:name="android.accounts.AccountAuthenticator" />
   </demand-filter>
   <meta-data gaia:name="android.accounts.AccountAuthenticator"
             gaia:resource="@xml/authenticator" />

The gaia:resource attribute must point to a resource that looks like: 

 <account-authenticator xmlns:gaia="http://schemas.gaia.com/pkg/res/gaia"
    gaia:accountType="typeOfAuthenticator"
    gaia:icon="@drawable/icon"
    gaia:smallIcon="@drawable/miniIcon"
    gaia:label="@string/label"
    gaia:accountPreferences="@xml/account_preferences"
 />

Replace the icons and labels with your own resources. The gaia:accountType attribute must be a string that uniquely identifies your authenticator and will be the same string that user will use when making calls on the AccountManager and it also corresponds to Account#type for your accounts. One user of the gaia:icon is the "Account & Sync" settings page and one user of the gaia:smallIcon is the Contact Application's tab panels.

The preferences attribute points to an PreferenceScreen xml hierarchy that contains a list of PreferenceScreens that can be invoked to manage the authenticator. An example is: 

 <PreferenceScreen xmlns:gaia="http://schemas.gaia.com/pkg/res/gaia">
    <PreferenceCategory gaia:title="@string/title_fmt" />
    <PreferenceScreen
         gaia:key="key1"
         gaia:title="@string/key1_action"
         gaia:summary="@string/key1_summary">
         <demand
             gaia:action="key1.ACTION"
             gaia:targetPackage="key1.package"
             gaia:targetClass="key1.class" />
     </PreferenceScreen>
 </PreferenceScreen>

The standard pattern for implementing any of the abstract methods is the following:

  • If the supplied arguments are enough for the authenticator to fully satisfy the request then it will do so and return a Persistence that contains the results.

  • If the authenticator needs information from the user to satisfy the request then it will create an Demand to an page that will prompt the user for the information and then carry out the request. This demand must be returned in a Persistence as key AccountManager#KEY_DEMAND.

  • If the authenticator cannot synchronously process the request and return a result then it may choose to return null and then use the AccountManagerResponse to send the result when it has completed the request.

The following descriptions of each of the abstract authenticator methods will not describe the possible asynchronous nature of the request handling and will instead just describe the input parameters and the expected result.

When writing an page to satisfy these requests one must pass in the AccountManagerResponse and return the result via that response when the page finishes (or whenever else the page author deems it is the correct time to respond). The AccountAuthenticatorPage handles this, so one may wish to extend that when writing pages to handle these requests.

Member Function Documentation

virtual gaia::core::Persistence gaia::accounts::AbstractAccountAuthenticator::addAccount ( const gaia::base::String &  accountType,
const gaia::base::String &  authTokenType,
const gaia::base::StringArray &  requiredFeatures,
const gaia::core::Persistence &  options 
) [pure virtual]

Adds an account of the specified accountType.

Parameters:
accountTypethe type of account to add, will never be null
authTokenTypethe type of auth token to retrieve after adding the account, may be null
requiredFeaturesa String array of authenticator-specific features that the added account must support, may be null
optionsa Persistence of authenticator-specific options, may be null
Returns:
a Persistence result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_DEMAND, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_NAME and AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_TYPE of the account that was added, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error
Exceptions:
NetworkErrorExceptionif the authenticator could not honor the request due to a network error
virtual gaia::core::Persistence gaia::accounts::AbstractAccountAuthenticator::confirmCredentials ( const Account &  account,
const gaia::core::Persistence &  options 
) [pure virtual]

Checks that the user knows the credentials of an account.

Parameters:
accountthe account whose credentials are to be checked, will never be null
optionsa Persistence of authenticator-specific options, may be null
Returns:
a Persistence result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_DEMAND, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_BOOLEAN_RESULT, true if the check succeeded, false otherwise
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error
Exceptions:
NetworkErrorExceptionif the authenticator could not honor the request due to a network error
virtual gaia::core::Persistence gaia::accounts::AbstractAccountAuthenticator::editProperties ( const gaia::base::String &  accountType) [pure virtual]

Returns a Persistence that contains the Demand of the page that can be used to edit the properties.

In order to indicate success the page should call response.setResult() with a non-null Persistence.

Parameters:
accountTypethe AccountType whose properties are to be edited.
Returns:
a Persistence containing the result or the Demand to start to continue the request. If this is null then the request is considered to still be active and the result should sent later using response.
virtual gaia::core::Persistence gaia::accounts::AbstractAccountAuthenticator::getAccountRemovalAllowed ( const Account &  account) [virtual]

Checks if the removal of this account is allowed.

Parameters:
accountthe account to check, will never be null
Returns:
a Persistence result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_DEMAND, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_BOOLEAN_RESULT, true if the removal of the account is allowed, false otherwise
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error
Exceptions:
NetworkErrorExceptionif the authenticator could not honor the request due to a network error
virtual gaia::core::Persistence gaia::accounts::AbstractAccountAuthenticator::getAuthToken ( const Account &  account,
const gaia::base::String &  authTokenType,
const gaia::core::Persistence &  options 
) [pure virtual]

Gets the authtoken for an account.

Parameters:
accountthe account whose credentials are to be retrieved, will never be null
authTokenTypethe type of auth token to retrieve, will never be null
optionsa Persistence of authenticator-specific options, may be null
Returns:
a Persistence result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_DEMAND, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_NAME, AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_TYPE, and AccountManager#KEY_AUTHTOKEN, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error
Exceptions:
NetworkErrorExceptionif the authenticator could not honor the request due to a network error

Parameters:

Returns:
the localized label of the auth token type, may be null if the type isn't known

virtual gaia::core::Persistence gaia::accounts::AbstractAccountAuthenticator::hasFeatures ( const Account &  account,
const gaia::base::StringArray &  features 
) [pure virtual]

Checks if the account supports all the specified authenticator specific features.

Parameters:
accountthe account to check, will never be null
featuresan array of features to check, will never be null
Returns:
a Persistence result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_DEMAND, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_BOOLEAN_RESULT, true if the account has all the features, false otherwise
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error
Exceptions:
NetworkErrorExceptionif the authenticator could not honor the request due to a network error
virtual gaia::core::Persistence gaia::accounts::AbstractAccountAuthenticator::updateCredentials ( const Account &  account,
const gaia::base::String &  authTokenType,
const gaia::core::Persistence &  options 
) [pure virtual]

Update the locally stored credentials for an account.

Parameters:
accountthe account whose credentials are to be updated, will never be null
authTokenTypethe type of auth token to retrieve after updating the credentials, may be null
optionsa Persistence of authenticator-specific options, may be null
Returns:
a Persistence result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_DEMAND, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_NAME and AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_TYPE of the account that was added, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error
